alert.note: Alert for Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 7:35AM EST until December 19 at 5:31AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Lehigh. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 AM EST, Both USGS gauges in Trexlertown were above flood stage. Water levels were still rising. Flooding will continue throughout the day. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell last night. - For Little Lehigh at Trexlertown near Little Lehigh Creek: At 7:15am the stage was 4.96 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. ... For Spring Creek at Trexlertown at Spring Creek: At 6:30am the stage was 5.29 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. - This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 49 and 50. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
